00020 =head1 NAME

00064 ################################################################################
00065 
00066 =item listCourses($ce)
00067 
00068 Lists the courses defined. 
00069 
00070 =cut
00071 
00072 sub listCourses {
00073     my ($ce) = @_;
00074     my $coursesDir = $ce->{webworkDirs}->{courses};
00075     return grep { not (m/^\./ or m/^CVS$/) and -d "$coursesDir/$_" } readDirectory($coursesDir);
00076 }
00077 
00078 =item listArchivedCourses($ce)
00079 
00080 Lists the courses which have been archived (end in .tar.gz). 
00081 
00082 =cut
00083 
00084 sub listArchivedCourses {
00085     my ($ce) = @_;
00086     my $coursesDir = $ce->{webworkDirs}->{courses};
00087     return grep { m/\.tar\.gz$/ } readDirectory($coursesDir);
00088 }

00090 ################################################################################
00091 
00092 =item addCourse(%options)
00093 
00094 %options must contain:
00095 
00096  courseID => $courseID,
00097  ce => $ce,
00098  courseOptions => $courseOptions, 
00099  dbOptions => $dbOptions,
00100  users => $users
00101 
00102 %options may contain:
00103 
00104  templatesFrom => $templatesCourseID,
00105 
00106 Create a new course named $courseID.
00107 
00108 $ce is a WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object that describes the new course's
00109 environment.
00110 
00111 $courseOptions is a reference to a hash containing the following options:
00112 
00113  dbLayoutName         => $dbLayoutName
00114  allowedRecipients    => $mail{allowedRecipients}
00115  feedbackRecipients   => $mail{feedbackRecipients}
00116  PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR => $pg{specialPGEnvironmentVars}->{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR}
00117 
00118 C<dbLayoutName> is required. C<allowedRecipients>, C<feedbackRecipients>, and
00119 C<PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR> are references to arrays.
00120 
00121 $dbOptions is a reference to a hash containing information required to create a
00122 database for the course. Current database layouts do not require additional
00123 information, so specify a reference to an empty hash. If $dbOptions is
00124 undefined, addCourse() assumes that the database has already been created, and
00125 skips that step in the course creation process.
00126 
00127 $users is a list of arrayrefs, each containing a User, Password, and
00128 PermissionLevel record for a single user:
00129 
00130  $users = [ $User, $Password, $PermissionLevel ]
00131 
00132 These users are added to the course.
00133 
00134 $templatesCourseID indicates the ID of a course from which the contents of the
00135 templates directory will be copied to the new course.
00136 
00137 =cut
00138 
00139 sub addCourse {
00140     my (%options) = @_;
00141     
00142     my $courseID = $options{courseID};
00143     my $ce = $options{ce};
00144     my %courseOptions = %{ $options{courseOptions} };
00145     my %dbOptions = defined $options{dbOptions} ? %{ $options{dbOptions} } : ();
00146     my @users = exists $options{users} ? @{ $options{users} } : ();
00147     
00148     # get the database layout out of the options hash
00149     my $dbLayoutName = $courseOptions{dbLayoutName};
00150     
00151     # collect some data
00152     my $coursesDir = $ce->{webworkDirs}->{courses};
00153     my $courseDir = "$coursesDir/$courseID";
00154     
00155     # fail if the course already exists
00156     # IMPORTANT: this must be the first check! if any check other than this one
00157     # fails, CourseAdmin deletes the course!! Oh no!!!
00158     # DO NOT CHANGE THE DIE MESSAGE -- CourseAdmin checks it to determine whether
00159     # a course was partially created and should be deleted!
00160     # FIXME -- this is bad, and addCourse should deal with cleaning up partially
00161     # created courses itself
00162     if (-e $courseDir) {
00163         croak "$courseID: course exists";
00164     }
00165     
00166     # fail if the course ID contains invalid characters
00167     croak "Invalid characters in course ID: '$courseID' (valid characters are [-A-Za-z0-9_])"
00168         unless $courseID =~ m/^[-A-Za-z0-9_]*$/;
00169     
00170     # if we didn't get a database layout, use the default one
00171     if (not defined $dbLayoutName) {
00172         $dbLayoutName = $ce->{dbLayoutName};
00173     }
00174     
00175     # fail if the database layout is invalid
00176     if (not exists $ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName}) {
00177         croak "$dbLayoutName: not found in \%dbLayouts";
00178     }
00179     
00180     ##### step 1: create course directory structure #####
00181     
00182     my %courseDirs = %{$ce->{courseDirs}};
00183     
00184     # deal with root directory first -- if we can't create it, we have to give up.
00185     
00186     exists $courseDirs{root} or croak "Can't create the course '$courseID' because no root directory is specified in the '%courseDirs' hash.";
00187     my $root = $courseDirs{root};
00188     delete $courseDirs{root};
00189     {
00190         # does the directory already exist?
00191         -e $root and croak "Can't create the course '$courseID' because the root directory '$root' already exists.";
00192         # is the parent directory writeable?
00193         my @rootElements = File::Spec->splitdir($root);
00194         pop @rootElements;
00195         my $rootParent = File::Spec->catdir(@rootElements);
00196         -w $rootParent or croak "Can't create the course '$courseID' because the courses directory '$rootParent' is not writeable.";
00197         # try to create it
00198         mkdir $root or croak "Can't create the course '$courseID' becasue the root directory '$root' could not be created: $!.";
00199     }
00200     
00201     # deal with the rest of the directories
00202     
00203     my @courseDirNames = sort { $courseDirs{$a} cmp $courseDirs{$b} } keys %courseDirs;
00204     foreach my $courseDirName (@courseDirNames) {
00205         my $courseDir = File::Spec->canonpath($courseDirs{$courseDirName});
00206         
00207         # does the directory already exist?
00208         if (-e $courseDir) {
00209             warn "Can't create $courseDirName directory '$courseDir', since it already exists. Using existing directory.\n";
00210             next;
00211         }
00212         
00213         # is the parent directory writeable?
00214         my @courseDirElements = File::Spec->splitdir($courseDir);
00215         pop @courseDirElements;
00216         my $courseDirParent = File::Spec->catdir(@courseDirElements);
00217         unless (-w $courseDirParent) {
00218             warn "Can't create $courseDirName directory '$courseDir', since the parent directory is not writeable. You will have to create this directory manually.\n";
00219             next;
00220         }
00221         
00222         # try to create it
00223         mkdir $courseDir or warn "Failed to create $courseDirName directory '$courseDir': $!. You will have to create this directory manually.\n";
00224     }
00225     
00226     ##### step 2: create course database #####
00227     
00228     my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName});
00229     my $create_db_result = $db->create_tables;
00230     die "$courseID: course database creation failed.\n" unless $create_db_result;
00231     
00232     ##### step 3: populate course database #####
00233     
00234     if ($ce->{dbLayouts}{$dbLayoutName}{user}{params}{non_native}) {
00235         debug("not adding users to the course database: 'user' table is non-native.\n");
00236     } else {
00237         # see above
00238         #my $db = WeBWorK::DB->new($ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName});
00239         
00240         foreach my $userTriple (@users) {
00241             my ($User, $Password, $PermissionLevel) = @$userTriple;
00242             
00243             eval { $db->addUser($User)                       }; warn $@ if $@;
00244             eval { $db->addPassword($Password)               }; warn $@ if $@;
00245             eval { $db->addPermissionLevel($PermissionLevel) }; warn $@ if $@;
00246         }
00247     }
00248     
00249     ##### step 4: write course.conf file #####
00250     
00251     my $courseEnvFile = $ce->{courseFiles}->{environment};
00252     open my $fh, ">", $courseEnvFile
00253         or die "failed to open $courseEnvFile for writing.\n";
00254     writeCourseConf($fh, $ce, %courseOptions);
00255     close $fh;
00256     
00257     ##### step 5: copy templates #####
00258     
00259     if (exists $options{templatesFrom}) {
00260         my $sourceCourse = $options{templatesFrom};
00261         my $sourceCE = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00262             get_SeedCE($ce),
00263             courseName => $sourceCourse,        # override courseName
00264         });
00265         my $sourceDir = $sourceCE->{courseDirs}->{templates};
00266         
00267         if (-d $sourceDir) {
00268             my $destDir = $ce->{courseDirs}{templates};
00269             my $cp_cmd = "2>&1 " . $ce->{externalPrograms}{cp} . " -R " . shell_quote($sourceDir) . "/* " . shell_quote($destDir);
00270             my $cp_out = readpipe $cp_cmd;
00271             if ($?) {
00272                 my $exit = $? >> 8;
00273                 my $signal = $? & 127;
00274                 my $core = $? & 128;
00275                 warn "Failed to copy templates from course '$sourceCourse' with command '$cp_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $cp_out\n";
00276             }
00277         } else {
00278             warn "Failed to copy templates from course '$sourceCourse': templates directory '$sourceDir' does not exist.\n";
00279         }
00280     }
00281 }
00282 
00283 ################################################################################
00284 
00285 =item renameCourse(%options)
00286 
00287 %options must contain:
00288 
00289  courseID => $courseID,
00290  ce => $ce,
00291  dbOptions => $dbOptions,
00292  newCourseID => $newCourseID,
00293 
00294 %options may also contain:
00295 
00296  skipDBRename => $skipDBRename,
00297 
00298 Rename the course named $courseID to $newCourseID.
00299 
00300 $ce is a WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object that describes the existing course's
00301 environment.
00302 
00303 $dbOptions is a reference to a hash containing information required to create
00304 the course's new database and delete the course's old database. Current database
00305 layouts do not require additional information, so specify a reference to an
00306 empty hash.
00307 
00308 The name of the course's directory is changed to $newCourseID.
00309 
00310 If the course's database layout is C<sql_single> or C<sql_moodle>, new tables
00311 are created in the current database, course data is copied from the old tables
00312 to the new tables, and the old tables are deleted.
00313 
00314 If the course's database layout is something else, no database changes are made.
00315 
00316 If $skipDBRename is true, no database changes are made. This is useful if a
00317 course is being unarchived and no database was found, or for renaming the
00318 modelCourse.
00319 
00320 Any errors encountered while renaming the course are returned.
00321 
00322 =cut
00323 
00324 sub renameCourse {
00325     my (%options) = @_;
00326     
00327     # renameCourseHelper needs:
00328     #    $fromCourseID ($oldCourseID)
00329     #    $fromCE ($oldCE)
00330     #    $toCourseID ($newCourseID)
00331     #    $toCE (construct from $oldCE)
00332     #    $dbLayoutName ($oldCE->{dbLayoutName})
00333     #    %options ($dbOptions)
00334     
00335     my $oldCourseID = $options{courseID};
00336     my $oldCE = $options{ce};
00337     my %dbOptions = defined $options{dbOptions} ? %{ $options{dbOptions} } : ();
00338     my $newCourseID = $options{newCourseID};
00339     my $skipDBRename = $options{skipDBRename} || 0;
00340     
00341     # get the database layout out of the options hash
00342     my $dbLayoutName = $oldCE->{dbLayoutName};
00343     
00344     # collect some data
00345     my $coursesDir = $oldCE->{webworkDirs}->{courses};
00346     my $oldCourseDir = "$coursesDir/$oldCourseID";
00347     my $newCourseDir = "$coursesDir/$newCourseID";
00348     
00349     # fail if the target course already exists
00350     if (-e $newCourseDir) {
00351         croak "$newCourseID: course exists";
00352     }
00353     
00354     # fail if the source course does not exist
00355     unless (-e $oldCourseDir) {
00356         croak "$oldCourseID: course not found";
00357     }
00358     
00359     ##### step 1: move course directory #####
00360     
00361     # move top-level course directory
00362     my $mv_cmd = "2>&1"." ".$oldCE->{externalPrograms}{mv}." ".shell_quote($oldCourseDir)." ".shell_quote($newCourseDir);
00363     debug("moving course dir: $mv_cmd");
00364     my $mv_out = readpipe $mv_cmd;
00365     if ($?) {
00366         my $exit = $? >> 8;
00367         my $signal = $? & 127;
00368         my $core = $? & 128;
00369         die "Failed to move course directory with command '$mv_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $mv_out\n";
00370     }
00371     
00372     # get new course environment
00373     my $newCE = $oldCE->new(
00374         $oldCE->{webworkDirs}->{root},
00375         $oldCE->{webworkURLs}->{root},
00376         $oldCE->{pg}->{directories}->{root},
00377         $newCourseID,
00378     );
00379     
00380     # find the course dirs that still exist in their original locations
00381     # (i.e. are not subdirs of $courseDir)
00382     my %oldCourseDirs = %{ $oldCE->{courseDirs} };
00383     my %newCourseDirs = %{ $newCE->{courseDirs} };
00384     my @courseDirNames = sort { $oldCourseDirs{$a} cmp $oldCourseDirs{$b} } keys %oldCourseDirs;
00385     foreach my $courseDirName (@courseDirNames) {
00386         my $oldDir = File::Spec->canonpath($oldCourseDirs{$courseDirName});
00387         my $newDir = File::Spec->canonpath($newCourseDirs{$courseDirName});
00388         if (-e $oldDir) {
00389             debug("oldDir $oldDir still exists. might move it...\n");
00390             
00391             # check for a few likely error conditions, since the mv error is not that helpful
00392             
00393             # is the source really a directory
00394             unless (-d $oldDir) {
00395                 warn "$courseDirName: Can't move '$oldDir' to '$newDir', since the source is not a directory. You will have to move this directory manually.\n";
00396                 next;
00397             }
00398             
00399             # does the destination already exist?
00400             # (this should only happen on extra-coursedir directories, since we make sure the root dir doesn't exist above.)
00401             if (-e $newDir) {
00402                 warn "$courseDirName: Can't move '$oldDir' to '$newDir', since the target already exists. You will have to move this directory manually.\n";
00403                 next;
00404             }
00405             
00406             # is oldDir's parent writeable
00407             my @oldDirElements = File::Spec->splitdir($oldDir);
00408             pop @oldDirElements;
00409             my $oldDirParent = File::Spec->catdir(@oldDirElements);
00410             unless (-w $oldDirParent) {
00411                 warn "$courseDirName: Can't move '$oldDir' to '$newDir', since the source parent directory is not writeable. You will have to move this directory manually.\n";
00412                 next;
00413             }
00414             
00415             # is newDir's parent writeable?
00416             my @newDirElements = File::Spec->splitdir($newDir);
00417             pop @newDirElements;
00418             my $newDirParent = File::Spec->catdir(@newDirElements);
00419             unless (-w $newDirParent) {
00420                 warn "$courseDirName: Can't move '$oldDir' to '$newDir', since the destination parent directory is not writeable. You will have to move this directory manually.\n";
00421                 next;
00422             }
00423             
00424             # try to move the directory
00425             debug("Going to move $oldDir to $newDir...\n");
00426             my $mv_cmd = "2>&1"." ".$oldCE->{externalPrograms}{mv}." ".shell_quote($oldDir)." ".shell_quote($newDir);
00427             my $mv_out = readpipe $mv_cmd;
00428             if ($?) {
00429                 my $exit = $? >> 8;
00430                 my $signal = $? & 127;
00431                 my $core = $? & 128;
00432                 warn "Failed to move directory with command '$mv_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $mv_out\n";
00433             }
00434         } else {
00435             debug("oldDir $oldDir was already moved.\n");
00436         }
00437     }
00438     
00439     ##### step 2: rename database #####
00440     
00441     unless ($skipDBRename) {
00442         my $oldDB = new WeBWorK::DB($oldCE->{dbLayouts}{$dbLayoutName});
00443         my $rename_db_result = $oldDB->rename_tables($newCE->{dbLayouts}{$dbLayoutName});
00444         die "$oldCourseID: course database renaming failed.\n" unless $rename_db_result;
00445     }
00446 }
00447 
00448 ################################################################################
00449 
00450 =item deleteCourse(%options)
00451 
00452 Options must contain:
00453 
00454  courseID => $courseID,
00455  ce => $ce,
00456  dbOptions => $dbOptions,
00457 
00458 $ce is a WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object that describes the course's
00459 environment. It is your responsability to pass a course environment object that
00460 describes the course to be deleted. Do not pass the course environment object
00461 associated with the request, unless you are deleting the course you're currently
00462 using.
00463 
00464 $dbOptions is a reference to a hash containing information required to delete
00465 the database for the course. Current database layouts do not require additional
00466 information, so specify a reference to an empty hash. If $dbOptions is
00467 undefined, addCourse() assumes that the database has already been deleted, and
00468 skips that step in the course deletion process.
00469 
00470 Deletes the course named $courseID. The course directory is removed.
00471 
00472 Any errors encountered while deleting the course are returned.
00473 
00474 =cut
00475 
00476 sub deleteCourse {
00477     my (%options) = @_;
00478     
00479     my $courseID = $options{courseID};
00480     my $ce = $options{ce};
00481     my %dbOptions = defined $options{dbOptions} ? %{ $options{dbOptions} } : ();
00482     
00483     # make sure the user isn't brain damaged
00484     die "the course environment supplied doesn't appear to describe the course $courseID. can't proceed."
00485         unless $ce->{courseName} eq $courseID;
00486     
00487     my %courseDirs = %{$ce->{courseDirs}};
00488     
00489     ##### step 0: make sure course directory is deleteable #####
00490     
00491     # deal with root directory first -- if we won't be able to delete it, we have to give up.
00492     
00493     exists $courseDirs{root} or croak "Can't delete the course '$courseID' because no root directory is specified in the '%courseDirs' hash.";
00494     my $root = $courseDirs{root};
00495     if (-e $root) {
00496         # is the parent directory writeable?
00497         my @rootElements = File::Spec->splitdir($root);
00498         pop @rootElements;
00499         my $rootParent = File::Spec->catdir(@rootElements);
00500         -w $rootParent or croak "Can't delete the course '$courseID' because the courses directory '$rootParent' is not writeable.";
00501     } else {
00502         warn "Warning: the course root directory '$root' does not exist. Attempting to delete the course database and other course directories...\n";
00503     }
00504     
00505     ##### step 1: delete course database (if necessary) #####
00506     
00507     my $dbLayoutName = $ce->{dbLayoutName};
00508     my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName});
00509     my $create_db_result = $db->delete_tables;
00510     die "$courseID: course database deletion failed.\n" unless $create_db_result;
00511     
00512     ##### step 2: delete course directory structure #####
00513     
00514     my @courseDirNames = sort { $courseDirs{$a} cmp $courseDirs{$b} } keys %courseDirs;
00515     foreach my $courseDirName (@courseDirNames) {
00516         my $courseDir = File::Spec->canonpath($courseDirs{$courseDirName});
00517         if (-e $courseDir) {
00518             debug("courseDir $courseDir still exists. might delete it...\n");
00519             
00520             # check for a few likely error conditions, since the mv error is not that helpful
00521             
00522             # is it really a directory
00523             unless (-d $courseDir) {
00524                 warn "Can't delete $courseDirName directory '$courseDir', since is not a directory. If it is not wanted, you will have to delete it manually.\n";
00525                 next;
00526             }
00527             
00528             # is the parent writeable
00529             my @courseDirElements = File::Spec->splitdir($courseDir);
00530             pop @courseDirElements;
00531             my $courseDirParent = File::Spec->catdir(@courseDirElements);
00532             unless (-w $courseDirParent) {
00533                 warn "Can't delete $courseDirName directory '$courseDir', since its parent directory is not writeable. If it is not wanted, you will have to delete it manually.\n";
00534                 next;
00535             }
00536             
00537             # try to delete the directory
00538             debug("Going to delete $courseDir...\n");
00539             rmtree($courseDir, 0, 1);
00540         } else {
00541             debug("courseDir $courseDir was already deleted.\n");
00542         }
00543     }
00544 }
00545 
00546 ################################################################################
00547 
00548 =item archiveCourse(%options)
00549 
00550 %options must contain:
00551 
00552  courseID  => $courseID,
00553  ce        => $ce,
00554 
00555 Creates a gzipped tar archive (.tar.gz) of the course $courseID in the WeBWorK
00556 courses directory. Before archiving, the course database is dumped into a
00557 subdirectory of the course's DATA directory.
00558 
00559 Only files and directories stored directly in the course directory are archived.
00560 The contents of linked files is not archived although the symbolic links
00561 themselves are saved.
00562 
00563 $courseID is the name of the course to archive.
00564 
00565 $ce is a WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object that describes the course's
00566 environment. (This is used to access the course database and get path
00567 information.)
00568 
00569 If an error occurs, an exception is thrown.
00570 
00571 =cut
00572 
00573 sub archiveCourse {
00574     my (%options) = @_;
00575     my $courseID = $options{courseID};
00576     my $ce = $options{ce};
00577     
00578     # make sure the user isn't brain damaged
00579     croak "The course environment supplied doesn't appear to match the course $courseID. Can't proceed"
00580         unless $ce->{courseName} eq $courseID;
00581     
00582     # grab some values we'll need
00583     my $course_dir = $ce->{courseDirs}{root};
00584     
00585     # tmp_archive_path is used as the target of the tar.gz operation
00586     # After this is done the final tar.gz file is moved either to the course directory
00587     # or the course/myCourse/templates   directory (when saving individual courses)
00588     # this prevents us from tarring a directory to which we have just added a file
00589     # see bug #2022 -- for error messages on some operating systems
00590     my $uuidStub = create_uuid_as_string();
00591     my $tmp_archive_path = $ce->{webworkDirs}{courses} . "/ ${uuidStub}_$courseID.tar.gz";
00592     my $data_dir = $ce->{courseDirs}{DATA};
00593     my $dump_dir = "$data_dir/mysqldump";
00594     my $archive_path;
00595     if ( PGcore::not_null( $options{archive_path} ) ) {
00596         $archive_path = $options{archive_path};
00597     } else {
00598         $archive_path = $ce->{webworkDirs}{courses} . "/$courseID.tar.gz";
00599     }
00600     
00601     
00602     # fail if the source course does not exist
00603     unless (-e $course_dir) {
00604         croak "$courseID: course not found";
00605     }
00606     
00607     # replace previous archived file if it exists.
00608     if (-e $archive_path) {
00609         unlink($archive_path) if (-w $archive_path);
00610         unless (-e $archive_path) {
00611             print CGI::p({-style=>'color:red; font-weight:bold'}, "The archival version of '$courseID' has been replaced'.\n");
00612         } else {
00613             croak "Unable to replace the archival version of '$courseID'";
00614         }
00615     }
00616     
00617     #### step 1: dump tables #####
00618     
00619     unless (-e $dump_dir) {
00620         mkdir $dump_dir or croak "Failed to create course database dump directory '$dump_dir': $!";
00621     }
00622     
00623     my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayout});
00624     my $dump_db_result = $db->dump_tables($dump_dir);
00625     unless ($dump_db_result) {
00626         _archiveCourse_remove_dump_dir($ce, $dump_dir);
00627         croak "$courseID: course database dump failed.\n";
00628     }
00629     
00630     ##### step 2: tar and gzip course directory (including dumped database) #####
00631     
00632     # we want tar to run from the parent directory of the course directory
00633     my $chdir_to = "$course_dir/..";
00634     
00635     my $tar_cmd = "2>&1 " . $ce->{externalPrograms}{tar}
00636         . " -C " . shell_quote($chdir_to)
00637         . " -czf " . shell_quote($tmp_archive_path)
00638         . " " . shell_quote($courseID);
00639     my $tar_out = readpipe $tar_cmd;
00640     if ($?) {
00641         my $exit = $? >> 8;
00642         my $signal = $? & 127;
00643         my $core = $? & 128;
00644         _archiveCourse_remove_dump_dir($ce, $dump_dir);
00645         croak "Failed to archive course directory '$course_dir' with command '$tar_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $tar_out\n";
00646     }
00647     
00648     ##### step 3: cleanup -- remove database dump files from course directory #####
00649     
00650     unless (-e $archive_path) {
00651         rename $tmp_archive_path, $archive_path;
00652     } else {  
00653         croak "Failed to create archived file at  '$archive_path'. File already exists.";
00654         unlink($tmp_archive_path);  #clean up   
00655     }
00656     _archiveCourse_remove_dump_dir($ce, $dump_dir);
00657 }
00658 
00659 sub _archiveCourse_remove_dump_dir {
00660     my ($ce, $dump_dir) = @_;
00661     my $rm_cmd = "2>&1 " . $ce->{externalPrograms}{rm}
00662         . " -rf " . shell_quote($dump_dir);
00663     my $rm_out = readpipe $rm_cmd;
00664     if ($?) {
00665         my $exit = $? >> 8;
00666         my $signal = $? & 127;
00667         my $core = $? & 128;
00668         carp "Failed to remove course database dump directory '$dump_dir' with command '$rm_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $rm_out\n";
00669     }
00670 }
00671 
00672 ################################################################################
00673 
00674 =item unarchiveCourse(%options)
00675 
00676 %options must contain:
00677 
00678  oldCourseID => $oldCourseID,
00679  archivePath => $archivePath,
00680  ce          => $ce,
00681 
00682 %options may also contain:
00683 
00684  newCourseID => $newCourseID,
00685 
00686 Restores course $oldCourseID from a gzipped tar archive (.tar.gz) located at
00687 $archivePath. After unarchiving, the course database is restored from a
00688 subdirectory of the course's DATA directory.
00689 
00690 If $newCourseID is defined and differs from $oldCourseID, the course is renamed
00691 after unarchiving.
00692 
00693 $ce is a WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object that describes the some course's
00694 environment. (Usually this would be the admin course.) This is used to access
00695 the course database and get path information.
00696 
00697 If an error occurs, an exception is thrown.
00698 
00699 =cut
00700 
00701 sub unarchiveCourse {
00702     my (%options) = @_;
00703     
00704     my $newCourseID = $options{newCourseID};
00705     my $currCourseID = $options{oldCourseID};
00706     my $archivePath = $options{archivePath};
00707     my $ce = $options{ce};
00708     
00709     my $coursesDir  = $ce->{webworkDirs}{courses};
00710     
00711     # Double check that the new course does not exist
00712     if (-e "$coursesDir/$newCourseID") {
00713         die "Cannot overwrite existing course $coursesDir/$newCourseID";
00714     }
00715     
00716     ##### step 1: move a conflicting course away #####
00717     
00718     # if this function returns undef, it means there was no course in the way
00719     my $restoreCourseData = _unarchiveCourse_move_away($ce, $currCourseID);
00720     
00721     ##### step 2: crack open the tarball #####
00722     
00723     my $tar_cmd = "2>&1 " . $ce->{externalPrograms}{tar}
00724         . " -C " . shell_quote($coursesDir)
00725         . " -xzf " . shell_quote($archivePath);
00726     my $tar_out = readpipe $tar_cmd;
00727     if ($?) {
00728         my $exit = $? >> 8;
00729         my $signal = $? & 127;
00730         my $core = $? & 128;
00731         _unarchiveCourse_move_back($restoreCourseData);
00732         die "Failed to unarchive course directory with command '$tar_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $tar_out\n";
00733     }
00734     
00735     ##### step 3: read the course environment for this course #####
00736     
00737     my $ce2 = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00738         get_SeedCE($ce),
00739         courseName => $currCourseID,
00740     });
00741     
00742     # pull out some useful stuff
00743     my $course_dir = $ce2->{courseDirs}{root};
00744     my $data_dir = $ce2->{courseDirs}{DATA};
00745     my $dump_dir = "$data_dir/mysqldump";
00746     my $old_dump_file = "$data_dir/${currCourseID}_mysql.database";
00747     
00748     ##### step 4: restore the database tables #####
00749     
00750     my $no_database;
00751     my $restore_db_result = 1;
00752     if (-e $dump_dir) {
00753         my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce2->{dbLayout});
00754         $restore_db_result = $db->restore_tables($dump_dir);
00755     } elsif (-e $old_dump_file) {
00756         my $dbLayoutName = $ce2->{dbLayoutName};
00757         if (ref getHelperRef("unarchiveCourseHelper", $dbLayoutName)) {
00758             eval {
00759                 $restore_db_result = unarchiveCourseHelper($currCourseID, $ce2, $dbLayoutName,
00760                     unarchiveDatabasePath=>$old_dump_file);
00761             };
00762             if ($@) {
00763                 warn "failed to unarchive course database from dump file '$old_dump_file: $@\n";
00764             }
00765         } else {
00766             warn "course '$currCourseID' uses dbLayout '$dbLayoutName', which doesn't support restoring database tables. database tables will not be restored.\n";
00767             $no_database = 1;
00768         }
00769     } else {
00770         warn "course '$currCourseID' has no database dump in its data directory (checked for $dump_dir and $old_dump_file). database tables will not be restored.\n";
00771         $no_database = 1;
00772     }
00773     
00774     unless ($restore_db_result) {
00775         warn "database restore of course '$currCourseID' failed: the course will probably not be usable.\n";
00776     }
00777     
00778     ##### step 5: delete dump_dir and/or old_dump_file #####
00779     
00780     if (-e $dump_dir) {
00781         _archiveCourse_remove_dump_dir($ce, $dump_dir);
00782     }
00783     if (-e $old_dump_file) {
00784         unlink $old_dump_file or carp "Failed to unlink course database dump file '$old_dump_file: $_\n";
00785     }
00786     
00787     ##### step 6: rename course #####
00788     
00789     if (defined $newCourseID and $newCourseID ne $currCourseID) {
00790         renameCourse(
00791             courseID     => $currCourseID,
00792             ce           => $ce2,
00793             newCourseID  => $newCourseID,
00794             skipDBRename => $no_database,
00795         );
00796     }
00797     
00798     ##### step 7: return conflicting course to its rightful place #####
00799     
00800     _unarchiveCourse_move_back($restoreCourseData);
00801 }
00802 
00803 sub _unarchiveCourse_move_away {
00804     my ($ce, $courseID) = @_;
00805     
00806     # course environment for before the course is moved
00807     my $ce2 = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00808         get_SeedCE($ce),
00809         courseName => $courseID,
00810     });
00811     
00812     # if course directory doesn't exist, we don't have to do anything
00813     return unless -e $ce2->{courseDirs}{root};
00814     
00815     # temporary name for course
00816     my $tmpCourseID = "${courseID}_tmp";
00817     
00818     debug("Temporarily moving $courseID to $tmpCourseID to make room for course unarchiving");
00819     renameCourse(
00820         courseID    => $courseID,
00821         ce          => $ce2,
00822         newCourseID => $tmpCourseID,
00823     );
00824     
00825     # course environment for after the course is moved
00826     my $ce3 = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00827         get_SeedCE($ce),
00828         courseName => $tmpCourseID,
00829     });
00830     
00831     # data to pass to renameCourse when moving the course back to it's original name
00832     my $restore_course_data = {
00833         courseID    => $tmpCourseID,
00834         ce          => $ce3, # course environment for moved course
00835         newCourseID => $courseID,
00836     };
00837     
00838     return $restore_course_data;
00839 }
00840 
00841 sub _unarchiveCourse_move_back {
00842     my ($restore_course_data) = @_;
00843     
00844     return unless $restore_course_data;
00845     
00846     debug("Moving $$restore_course_data{courseID} back to $$restore_course_data{newCourseID} after course unarchiving");
00847     renameCourse(%$restore_course_data);
00848 }
00849 
00850 ################################################################################
00851 
00852 =item dbLayoutSQLSources($dbLayout)
00853 
00854 Retrun a hash of database sources for the sql and sql_single database layouts.
00855 Each element of the hash takes this form:
00856 
00857  dbi_source => {
00858      tables => [ 'table1', 'table2', ... ],
00859      username => 'username',
00860      password => 'password',
00861  }
00862 
00863 In the common case, there will only be one source returned.
00864 
00865 =cut
00866 
00867 sub dbLayoutSQLSources {
00868     my ($dbLayout) = @_;
00869     
00870     my %dbLayout = %$dbLayout;
00871     my @tables = keys %dbLayout;
00872     
00873     my %sources;
00874     
00875     foreach my $table (@tables) {
00876         my %table = %{ $dbLayout{$table} };
00877         my %params = %{ $table{params} };
00878         
00879         if ($params{non_native}) {
00880             debug("$table: marked non-native, skipping\n");
00881             next;
00882         }
00883         
00884         my $source = $table{source};
00885         my $username = $params{username};
00886         my $password = $params{password};
00887         
00888         push @{$sources{$source}{tables}}, $table;
00889         
00890         if (defined $sources{$source}{username}) {
00891             if ($sources{$source}{username} ne $username) {
00892                 warn "conflicting usernames for source '$source':",
00893                     " '$sources{$source}{username}', '$username'\n";
00894             } else {
00895                 # it's all good
00896             }
00897         } else {
00898             $sources{$source}{username} = $username;
00899         }
00900         
00901         if (defined $sources{$source}{password}) {
00902             if ($sources{$source}{password} ne $password) {
00903                 warn "conflicting passwords for source '$source':",
00904                     " '$sources{$source}{password}', '$password'\n";
00905             } else {
00906                 # it's all good
00907             }
00908         } else {
00909             $sources{$source}{password} = $password;
00910         }
00911     }
00912     
00913     return %sources;
00914 }
00915 
00916 =back
00917 
00918 =cut
00919 
00920 ################################################################################
00921 # database helpers
00922 ################################################################################
00923 
00924 =head1 DATABASE-LAYOUT SPECIFIC HELPER FUNCTIONS
00925 
00926 These functions are used to perform database-layout specific operations.
00927 
00928 The implementations in this class do nothing, but if an appropriate function
00929 exists in a class with the name
00930 WeBWorK::Utils::CourseManagement::I<$dbLayoutName>, it will be used instead.
00931 
00932 =over
00933 
00934 =item archiveCourseHelper($courseID, $ce, $dbLayoutName, %options)
00935 
00936 Perform database-layout specific operations for archiving the data in a course.
00937 
00938 =cut
00939 
00940 sub archiveCourseHelper {
00941     my ($courseID, $ce, $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00942     my $result = callHelperIfExists("archiveCourseHelper", $dbLayoutName, @_);
00943     return $result;
00944 }
00945 
00946 =item unarchiveCourseHelper($courseID, $ce, $dbLayoutName, %options)
00947 
00948 Perform database-layout specific operations for unarchiving the data in a course
00949 and placing it in the database.
00950 
00951 =cut
00952 
00953 sub unarchiveCourseHelper {
00954     my ($courseID, $ce, $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00955     my $result = callHelperIfExists("unarchiveCourseHelper", $dbLayoutName, @_);
00956     return $result;
00957 }
00958 
00959 =item initNonNativeTables($ce, $db, $dbLayoutName, %options)
00960 
00961 Perform database-layout specific operations for initializing non-native database tables
00962 that are not associated with a particular course
00963 
00964 =cut
00965 
00966 sub initNonNativeTables {
00967     my($ce, $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00968     my $str = '';
00969     # Create a database handler
00970     my $db = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName});
00971     
00972      # lock database
00973      
00974     # Find the names of the non-native database tables 
00975     foreach my $table (sort keys %$db) {
00976         next unless $db->{$table}{params}{non_native}; # only look at non-native tables
00977         my $database_table_name = (exists $db->{$table}->{params}->{tableOverride})? $db->{$table}->{params}->{tableOverride}:$table;
00978         #warn "table is $table";
00979         #warn "checking $database_table_name";
00980         my $database_table_exists = ($db->{$table}->tableExists) ? 1:0;
00981         unless ($database_table_exists ) { # exists means the table can be described;
00982             my $schema_obj = $db->{$table};
00983             if ($schema_obj->can("create_table")) {
00984                 #warn "creating table $database_table_name  with object $schema_obj";
00985                 $schema_obj->create_table;
00986                 $str .= "Table '$table' created as '$database_table_name' in database.".CGI::br();
00987             } else {
00988                 # warn "Skipping creation of '$table' table: no create_table method\n";
00989             }
00990         
00991         }
00992        
00993     }
00994     
00995     # unlock database
00996     $str;
00997 
00998 
00999 }
01000 
01001 
01002 
01003 ################################################################################
01004 # utilities
01005 ################################################################################
01006 
01007 =head1 UTILITIES
01008 
01009 These functions are used by this class's public functions and should not be
01010 called directly.
01011 
01012 =over
01013 
01014 =item callHelperIfExists($helperName, $dbLayoutName, @args)
01015 
01016 Call a database-specific helper function, if a database-layout specific helper
01017 class exists and contains a function named "${helperName}Helper".
01018 
01019 =cut
01020 
01021 sub callHelperIfExists {
01022     my ($helperName, $dbLayoutName, @args) = @_;
01023     
01024     my $helperRef = getHelperRef($helperName, $dbLayoutName);
01025     if (ref $helperRef) {
01026         return $helperRef->(@args);
01027     } else {
01028         return $helperRef;
01029     }
01030 }
01031 
01032 =over
01033 
01034 =item getHelperRef($helperName, $dbLayoutName)
01035 
01036 Call a database-specific helper function, if a database-layout specific helper
01037 class exists and contains a function named "${helperName}Helper".
01038 
01039 =cut
01040 sub getHelperRef {
01041     my ($helperName, $dbLayoutName) = @_;
01042     
01043     my $result;
01044     
01045     my $package = __PACKAGE__ . "::$dbLayoutName";
01046     
01047     eval { runtime_use $package };
01048     if ($@) {
01049         if ($@ =~ /^Can't locate/) {
01050             debug("No database-layout specific library for layout '$dbLayoutName'.\n");
01051             $result = 1;
01052         } else {
01053             warn "Failed to load database-layout specific library: $@\n";
01054             $result = 0;
01055         }
01056     } else {
01057         my %syms = do { no strict 'refs'; %{$package."::"} };
01058         if (exists $syms{$helperName}) {
01059             $result = do { no strict 'refs'; \&{$package."::".$helperName} };
01060         } else {
01061             debug("No helper defined for operation '$helperName'.\n");
01062             $result = 1;
01063         }
01064     }
01065     
01066     #warn "getHelperRef = '$result'\n";
01067     return $result;
01068 }
01069 
01070 =item protectQString($string)
01071 
01072 Protects the contents of a single-quoted Perl string.
01073 
01074 =cut
01075 
01076 sub protectQString {
01077     my ($string) = @_;
01078     $string =~ s/'/\'/g;
01079     return $string;
01080 }
01081 
01082 =item writeCourseConf($fh, $ce, %options)
01083 
01084 Writes a course.conf file to $fh, a file handle, using defaults from the course
01085 environment object $ce and overrides from %options. %options can contain any of
01086 the pairs accepted in %courseOptions by addCourse(), above.
01087 
01088 =cut
01089 
01090 sub writeCourseConf {
01091     my ($fh, $ce, %options) = @_;
01092     
01093     # several options should be defined no matter what
01094     $options{dbLayoutName} = $ce->{dbLayoutName} unless defined $options{dbLayoutName};
01095     
01096     print $fh <<'EOF';
01097 #!perl
01098 ################################################################################
01099 # WeBWorK Online Homework Delivery System
01100 # Copyright © 2000-2007 The WeBWorK Project, http://openwebwork.sf.net/
01101 # 
01102 # This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
01103 # the terms of either: (a) the GNU General Public License as published by the
01104 # Free Software Foundation; either version 2, or (at your option) any later
01105 # version, or (b) the "Artistic License" which comes with this package.
01106 # 
01107 # This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT
01108 # ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
01109 # FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See either the GNU General Public License or the
01110 # Artistic License for more details.
01111 ################################################################################
01112 
01113 # This file is used to override the global WeBWorK course environment for
01114 # requests to this course. All package variables set in this file are added to
01115 # the course environment. If you wish to set a variable here but omit it from
01116 # the course environment,  use the "my" keyword. Commonly changed configuration
01117 # options are noted below.
01118 
01119 EOF
01120     
01121     print $fh <<'EOF';
01122 # Database Layout (global value typically defined in global.conf)
01123 # 
01124 # Several database are defined in the file conf/database.conf and stored in the
01125 # hash %dbLayouts.
01126 # 
01127 # The database layout is always set here, since one should be able to change the
01128 # default value in global.conf without disrupting existing courses.
01129 # 
01130 # global.conf values:
01131 EOF
01132     
01133     print $fh "# \t", '$dbLayoutName = \'', protectQString($ce->{dbLayoutName}), '\';', "\n";
01134     print $fh "# \t", '*dbLayout = $dbLayouts{$dbLayoutName};', "\n";
01135     print $fh "\n";
01136     
01137     if (defined $options{dbLayoutName}) {
01138         print $fh '$dbLayoutName = \'', protectQString($options{dbLayoutName}), '\';', "\n";
01139         print $fh '*dbLayout = $dbLayouts{$dbLayoutName};', "\n";
01140         print $fh "\n";
01141     } else {
01142         print $fh "\n\n\n";
01143     }
01144     
01145     print $fh <<'EOF';
01146 # Allowed Mail Recipients (global value typically not defined)
01147 # 
01148 # Defines addresses to which the PG system is allowed to send mail. This should
01149 # probably be set to the addresses of professors of this course. Sending mail
01150 # from the PG system (i.e. questionaires, essay questions) will fail if this is
01151 # not set.
01152 # 
01153 # global.conf values:
01154 EOF
01155     
01156     if (defined $ce->{mail}->{allowedRecipients}) {
01157         print $fh "# \t", '$mail{allowedRecipients} = [',
01158                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $ce->{mail}->{allowedRecipients} }), '];', "\n";
01159     } else {
01160         print $fh "# \t", '$mail{allowedRecipients} = [  ];', "\n";
01161     }
01162     print $fh "\n";
01163     
01164     if (defined $options{allowedRecipients}) {
01165         print $fh '$mail{allowedRecipients} = [',
01166                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $options{allowedRecipients} }), '];', "\n";
01167         print $fh "\n";
01168     } else {
01169         print $fh "\n\n\n";
01170     }
01171     
01172     print $fh <<'EOF';
01173 # By default, feeback is sent to all users who have permission to
01174 # receive_feedback. If this list is non-empty, feedback is also sent to the
01175 # addresses specified here.
01176 # 
01177 # * If you want to disable feedback altogether, leave this empty and set
01178 #   $permissionLevels{submit_feeback} = undef;
01179 #   This will cause the
01180 #   feedback button to go away as well.
01181 # 
01182 # * If you want to send email ONLY to addresses in this list, set
01183 #   $permissionLevels{receive_feedback} = undef; 
01184 # 
01185 # It's often useful to set this in the course.conf to change the behavior of
01186 # feedback for a specific course.
01187 # global.conf values:
01188 EOF
01189     
01190     if (defined $ce->{mail}->{feedbackRecipients}) {
01191         print $fh "# \t", '$mail{feedbackRecipients} = [',
01192                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $ce->{mail}->{feedbackRecipients} }), '];', "\n";
01193     } else {
01194         print $fh "# \t", '$mail{feedbackRecipients} = [  ];', "\n";
01195     }
01196     print $fh "\n";
01197     
01198     if (defined $options{feedbackRecipients}) {
01199         print $fh '$mail{feedbackRecipients} = [',
01200                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $options{feedbackRecipients} }), '];', "\n";
01201         print $fh "\n";
01202     } else {
01203         print $fh "\n\n\n";
01204     }
01205     
01206     print $fh <<'EOF';
01207 # Users for whom to label problems with the PG file name (global value typically "professor")
01208 # 
01209 # For users in this list, PG will display the source file name when rendering a problem.
01210 # 
01211 # global.conf values:
01212 EOF
01213     
01214     if (defined $ce->{pg}{specialPGEnvironmentVars}{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR}) {
01215         print $fh "# \t", '$pg{specialPGEnvironmentVars}{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR} = [',
01216                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $ce->{pg}{specialPGEnvironmentVars}{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR} }), '];', "\n";
01217     } else {
01218         print $fh "# \t", '$pg{specialPGEnvironmentVars}{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR} = [  ];', "\n";
01219     }
01220     print $fh "\n";
01221     
01222     if (defined $options{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR}) {
01223         print $fh '$pg{specialPGEnvironmentVars}{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR} = [',
01224                 join(", ", map { "'" . protectQString($_) . "'" } @{ $options{PRINT_FILE_NAMES_FOR} }), '];', "\n";
01225         print $fh "\n";
01226     } else {
01227         print $fh "\n\n\n";
01228     }
01229 }
01230 
01231 
01232 sub get_SeedCE {     # helper subroutine to produce a stripped down seed Course Environment from an arbitrary course environment
01233     my $ce = shift;
01234     warn "get_SeedCE needs current Course environment to create seed CE" unless ref($ce) ;
01235     my %seedCE=();
01236     my @conf_items = qw( webwork_dir webwork_url pg_dir courseName)   ;  # items to transfer. courseName is often overridden
01237     foreach my $item (@conf_items) {
01238             $seedCE{$item} = $ce->{$item};
01239     }
01240     return( %seedCE);
01241 }
01242 1;
